intro: Silene caroliniana subsp. caroliniana, commonly known as the Carolina catchfly, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its pink to red flowers and hairy, erect stems that grow up to 30 centimeters tall. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with toothed edges and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges, and is often found in sandy or loamy soils. Silene caroliniana subsp. caroliniana is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, known for its showy flowers and succulent stems.
